Production Pharmacist Job at Vixa Healthcare




        
    

        
        Vixa Healthcare, a manufacturing company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Pharmacist

Job Locations: Ibafo - Ogun & Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role


	Responsible for production activities, starting from incoming materials to outgoing Finished goods.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Involvement with pilot scale trials of products under development.
	Ensure proper operation, cleaning and maintenance of production equipment and to report any malfunctioning to the appropriate department.
	Ensure strict compliance with production plans and generating daily production reports including variances.
	To monitor production operations and records in accordance with Master formula from the start of production till completion
	Ensure all processes are done in strict compliance to current Good Manufacturing Practices.
	Validation of production processes, preparation and preparation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
	To ensure manufacturing and packaging operations are carried out as per SOPs.
	To ensure that the appropriate Qualifications and calibrations of Production equipment are performed as per SOP and the reports are generated.
	Ensure appropriate inventory in conjunction with the store officer to ensure timely supply of materials needed for production.
	Share responsibility with the maintenance team in ensuring that all production equipment is standardized and certified.
	Liaising with all maintenance/engineering and quality departments to ensure smooth production.
	In conjunction with QC/QA, Engineering and other applicable departments, carry out deviation investigation of processes and procedures related to manufacturing and packaging operations.
	Oversee production operations in conjunction with other Sectional heads and Supervisors to ensure compliance with cGMP.
	Participate in New Project in terms of product development and re-formulation being carried out to suit local market environment in line with cGMP guidelines.


Qualifications


	Proven experience as a pharmacist
	Thorough understanding of dosage administration and measurement, chemical compounds, medical brands etc
	Outstanding knowledge of MS Office and pharmacy information system
	Good organizing skills
	Excellent communication skills with a customer oriented approach.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: pharmarecruitment2online@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidate will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Bemil Nigeria Limited
content:
Bemil Nigeria Limited is a wholly indigenous company which has been at the forefront of providing Security Management, Cash-In-Transit / Valuable Protection and Security Consultancy & Training since its inception in 1978.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Area Manager

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    




	Recruit Guards for clients with man guard needs
	Screen resourced/recruited candidates for training.
	Administer the company employment form and guide candidates to fill them properly.
	Ensure proper update of staff records.
	Overseeing employee orientation and training.
	Liaising between employees and management.
	Undertaking communications and interpersonal skills training.
	Arranging employee physical examinations.
	Prepares reports and enters and updates leave, leave allowance and other entitlements
	Ensures accurate attendance entry and submitted on time.
	Send in All documentations of new staff before deployment.
	Assist with the computations & submission of overtime and documentations on payroll.
	Ensures strict compliance with the company policies & procedures.
	Candidates are to carry out vetting and document verifications.
	Act as area manager to patrol and supervise guards in different locations.
	Perform risk assessments and write reports on this.
	Responsible and accountable for all company property at the branch Office.
	Supervise administrative staffs if any (Drivers, cleaners, guards, assistants etc.)
	Maintain Official vehicles, motorbikes, computers, phones etc at the branch office
	Collaborate with other departments for voucher payments etc.
	Managing employee / client.
	Any other tasks assigned.complaints.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adebimpe@bemilnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires call; 08090366018.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a reliable, literate, and well-presented Domestic Personal Assistant / House Manager to provide day-to-day support in a private residence.
	The ideal candidate must have strong communication skills, be able to use a mobile phone and WhatsApp effectively, and possess a stable family background.


Requirements


	Must be literate and able to communicate in reasonable English.
	Preferably of Yoruba tribe.
	Must be smart-looking, neat, and well-organized.
	Must come from a nuclear family background (family of 4 preferred).
	Must be 40–50 years old.
	Must have driver's license.
	Must reside within Lagos Island/Obalende/Ajah axis.
	Must have at least 10 years experience in domestic or similar roles.
	Must be comfortable using mobile phone, WhatsApp, and basic digital tools.
	Honest, trustworthy, and respectful.
	Good moral values and family-oriented.
	Calm, patient, and emotionally stable.
	Good appearance and presentable dressing.
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Benefits


	Competitive monthly salary (N150,000 – N250,000).
	Free accommodation provided.
	Supportive work environment.
	Long-term stability for qualified candidate.


Application Closing Date: 21st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@bemilnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Human Resource Manager (Female)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the company's goals.
	Lead the HR team in designing, planning, and executing HR programs and initiatives.
	Manage the recruitment process, including sourcing, interviewing, and selecting candidates.
	Develop and maintain effective recruitment and onboarding strategies to attract top talent.
	Oversee the development of job descriptions and job specifications.
	Provide guidance on employee relations issues and mediate conflicts as needed.
	Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations and update company policies as required.
	Conduct exit interviews and analyze data to improve retention and engagement.
	Implement performance appraisal systems, monitor performance reviews, and provide feedback.
	Develop and lead performance improvement plans as necessary.
	Identify training needs, plan, and coordinate training programs.
	Encourage continuous learning and professional development for all employees.
	Administer compensation and benefits programs and make recommendations for enhancements.
	Ensure salary structures are competitive and aligned with industry standards.
	Manage monthly payroll to ensure alignment with employment laws, (taking into account, Attendance, Punctuality, absenteeism, etc.).
	Utilize HR analytics to provide insights and support data-driven decision-making.
	Prepare regular reports on HR metrics and trends for senior management.
	Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local labor laws.
	Develop and update HR policies and procedures as needed.
	Promote a positive workplace culture and oversee employee engagement programs.
	Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee morale and satisfaction.
	Lead, mentor, and develop the HR team, providing coaching and feedback.
	Ensure effective communication and teamwork within the HR department.
	Any other responsibilities as may be deemed necessary for your role.
	Other activities as assigned by management or may lead to the growth of the organization as a whole.


Qualifications and Skills


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree
	7+ years of HR Generalist experience.
	Passionate and proactive about employee Engagement.
	Self-aware and motivated to make a real impact.
	Strong knowledge of HR practices, employment laws, and regulations.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Proficiency with HRIS (Human Resources Information System) software.
	HR certification (e.g, CIPMN, PHRi, SPHRi, SHRM-CP e.t.c) is a plus.
	Culture-Oriented Mindset
	Must have a can-do attitude
	Must be apt in proactive problem-solving
	Must be interested in continuous learning
	Must always take responsibility and be accountable for individual and group goals.
	Must be able to work smart and leverage relationships for outstanding results.


Salary
N700,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 20th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@bemilnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
